hey everyone,

just wanted to let everyone know that i've got my rabbits up and 
running. they have four camera's for food and four cameras for walls. 
every generation keeps 20 and kill 80 (maybe thats too much). my 
roommate and i have been working on it the last couple of days so we 
were pretty excited to see them develop. Also, we havent implemented 
neat. we just have 9 inputs going into 2 outputs. however, we've 
started running into problems that i was hoping to get some advice 
for.

first, we have two outputs, if the first output is between -10 and 
10, we make it stay, if it is less than -10 we make it go left and 
right if it is above 10. we do the the same with the other node 
except for up down. is there a better way to do this?

second, we always seem to have some immediate improvement but then 
some major stagnation for about 1000 generations then maybe some 
minor improvements over the next however many generations we run it. 
in our simulated world, rabbits all start in the middle and get 100 
moves to get as much food as they can. fitness is defined as how many 
pieces of food you get.

thirdly, can anyone explain the logic behind how neat is implemented? 
for example, with what percentage should a node or connections be 
added and why?

finally, we get about 5 sec / 100 generations (with 100 rabbits) but 
that is with extremely limited vision (written in C) if we extend the 
vision one more space in each direction, it drops to about 15 sec/ 
100 generations. is this....ok?

anyway, i would appreciate anyone's input. thanks

-timmy
